body_html:
Sure I'm on my way to airport, I think I'll have plenty of time to fix that
…
On Tue, Dec 26, 2017, 5:14 PM Fritz Obermeyer ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. Would you mind cleaning up some unrelated Uniform import issues in this PR (to avoid an extra nuisance PR)? If that's a pain, we can fix them as part of Cauchy or something. ------------------------------ In torch/distributions/__init__.py <#4346 (comment)>: > @@ -39,6 +39,8 @@ from .normal import Normal from .exponential import Exponential from .laplace import Laplace +from .chi2 import Chi2 @alicanb <https://github.com/alicanb> Would you mind importing Uniform in this PR to help clean up? from .uniform import Uniform since it was missed in #4328 <#4328> ? ------------------------------ In test/test_distributions.py <#4346 (comment)>: > @@ -7,7 +7,7 @@ import torch from common import TestCase, run_tests from torch.autograd import Variable, gradcheck -from torch.distributions import (Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Dirichlet, +from torch.distributions import (Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Chi2, Dirichlet, Exponential, Gamma, Laplace, Normal) from torch.distributions.uniform import Uniform Would you mind cleaning up the Uniform import, moving it into from torch.distributions import ...? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#4346 (review)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABCw1uRFMSlM46zA6uHy-gEzoGsWxr3Jks5tEW_EgaJpZM4RMGTQ> .
body_text:
Sure I'm on my way to airport, I think I'll have plenty of time to fix that
…
On Tue, Dec 26, 2017, 5:14 PM Fritz Obermeyer ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.

 Would you mind cleaning up some unrelated Uniform import issues in this
 PR (to avoid an extra nuisance PR)? If that's a pain, we can fix them as
 part of Cauchy or something.
 ------------------------------

 In torch/distributions/__init__.py
 <#4346 (comment)>:

 > @@ -39,6 +39,8 @@
  from .normal import Normal
  from .exponential import Exponential
  from .laplace import Laplace
 +from .chi2 import Chi2

 @alicanb <https://github.com/alicanb> Would you mind importing Uniform in
 this PR to help clean up?

 from .uniform import Uniform

 since it was missed in #4328
 <#4328> ?
 ------------------------------

 In test/test_distributions.py
 <#4346 (comment)>:

 > @@ -7,7 +7,7 @@
  import torch
  from common import TestCase, run_tests
  from torch.autograd import Variable, gradcheck
 -from torch.distributions import (Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Dirichlet,
 +from torch.distributions import (Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Chi2, Dirichlet,
                                   Exponential, Gamma, Laplace, Normal)
  from torch.distributions.uniform import Uniform

 Would you mind cleaning up the Uniform import, moving it into from
 torch.distributions import ...?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.


 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#4346 (review)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABCw1uRFMSlM46zA6uHy-gEzoGsWxr3Jks5tEW_EgaJpZM4RMGTQ>
 .
body:
Sure I'm on my way to airport, I think I'll have plenty of time to fix that

On Tue, Dec 26, 2017, 5:14 PM Fritz Obermeyer <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@fritzo* commented on this pull request.
>
> Would you mind cleaning up some unrelated Uniform import issues in this
> PR (to avoid an extra nuisance PR)? If that's a pain, we can fix them as
> part of Cauchy or something.
> ------------------------------
>
> In torch/distributions/__init__.py
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4346#discussion_r158743685>:
>
> > @@ -39,6 +39,8 @@
>  from .normal import Normal
>  from .exponential import Exponential
>  from .laplace import Laplace
> +from .chi2 import Chi2
>
> @alicanb <https://github.com/alicanb> Would you mind importing Uniform in
> this PR to help clean up?
>
> from .uniform import Uniform
>
> since it was missed in #4328
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4328> ?
> ------------------------------
>
> In test/test_distributions.py
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4346#discussion_r158743716>:
>
> > @@ -7,7 +7,7 @@
>  import torch
>  from common import TestCase, run_tests
>  from torch.autograd import Variable, gradcheck
> -from torch.distributions import (Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Dirichlet,
> +from torch.distributions import (Bernoulli, Beta, Categorical, Chi2, Dirichlet,
>                                   Exponential, Gamma, Laplace, Normal)
>  from torch.distributions.uniform import Uniform
>
> Would you mind cleaning up the Uniform import, moving it into from
> torch.distributions import ...?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>
>
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4346#pullrequestreview-85594625>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABCw1uRFMSlM46zA6uHy-gEzoGsWxr3Jks5tEW_EgaJpZM4RMGTQ>
> .
